blocks.content: The next step in your journey takes you to installing Grafana Alloy. Alloy offers native pipelines for OTel, Prometheus, Pyroscope, Loki, and many other metrics, logs, traces, and profile tools.
In the **Install Alloy** section, click **Run Grafana Alloy**.
You must either use an existing token or create a new one. The token safeguards against unauthorized access, ensuring that only you can install Alloy on your Linux machine.
Click **Create new token** (or **Use an existing token** if you have one).
Verify that the **Enable Remote Configuration** toggle is set to on.
In the **Install and run Grafana Alloy** section, click **Copy to Clipboard**.

Now, log in to your Linux machine, open the Terminal, and paste the contents of the clipboard. Press **Enter** to install Grafana Alloy. When the installation is complete, you'll see `Alloy is now running!`
Click **Test Alloy connection** to verify that Grafana Alloy is installed correctly.
If Grafana Alloy is installed correctly, you'll see `Awesome! Grafana Alloy is good to go`.
Click **Proceed to install integration** to continue.
